definition[0]: to send something, usually by post, to a place where it can be dealt with
example[0]: I sent in a few job applications last week.
definition[1]: to send soldiers, police etc somewhere to deal with a difficult or dangerous situation
example[1]: British troops were sent in as part of the peace-keeping force.
definition[2]: to send something, usually by mail, to a place where it can be dealt with
example[2]: Customers can send in their sales receipts to get the discount coupons.
definition[3]: to tell someone to go somewhere to do a particular task, especially a difficult one
example[3]: The DTI may send in inspectors who will, if necessary, stop the company trading.
